item.title: Hand Drawn
item.description: First go at hand drawn animation. I’m using an led lightbox. This is 4 drawings at 5 frames per second, looped 10 times. Here is a close up of the duck, ball and hand.

item.title: Dragon
item.description: Here is a dragon falling over

item.title: Whale
item.description: Here is a wiggly whale at 10 frames per second Exposure Time 1/6 second Aperture value f/9.9 ISO Speed Rating 400 Metering Mode Partial Focal Length 39.0 mm

item.title: Ducks
item.description: Using Van Aken Claytoon modeling clay. Making these ducks turned my hands yellow. Playing with Entangle to set up the shot. The shots for the animation had these settings: Exposure Time 1 second Aperture value f/5.0 ISO Speed Rating 100 Metering Mode Pattern Focal Length 39.0 mm There are 14 pictures in the animation.

item.title: Making the website
item.description: First off I used Jekyll to create a static site. I chose hyde as theme because I liked the fixed side bar and minimal design. I used github pages to host the site. After playing with Jekyll a bit and having some trouble with ruby on my Mac, I swapped to using Hugo rather than Jekyll. Creating a new site and initializing a git repository: hugo new site fushandchups cd fushandchups git init I use one respository for the site creation, which is private.

item.title: My First Animation
item.description: Here we go: I uploaded the mp4 to youtube, mostly because I can’t get the embeded video to work with hugo/linux/firefox. Here is my first second of animation

item.title: First Pics
item.description: Remote camera testing. My favourite mug for test pictures. I have the camera set to manual focus and contol the aperture options with Entangle.

item.title: First Post
item.description: Stop Motion Animation Here is my equipment: 12 year old Cannon DSLR 12 year old thinkpad The camera is Canon Rebel XS. Rebel! To control the camera remotely I use a latop. The laptop is a 2008 thinkpad running Linux Mint. I use Entangle to control the camera. Entangle lets you view the live preview of the camera, which is great for setting up shots. The camera I have does not have live preview on the LCD screen.
